title: Chelsea fans have a theory for Eden Hazard’s performance v Liverpool
text:
Chelsea fans have a theory for Eden Hazard’s performance v Liverpool By Benjamin Newman   Eden Hazard v Liverpool 
Eden Hazard had another average performance for Chelsea on Tuesday night. 
The Belgium international has been drawing questions in recent weeks as he’s struggled to produce, however at Anfield Hazard did win the free-kick before David Luiz’s opener. 
In general this season, Hazard has produced his best performances at Stamford Bridge, while away from home he’s often been far less effective. 
But could there be a reason for Hazard’s form other than the obvious? What about his health? 
There’s a rumour doing the rounds that Hazard might not be fit. 
It’s not clear what injury Hazard is carrying, but it feels like this theory could be a handy excuse for below-par performances. 
It should be stressed that there’s no hard evidence backing up the Hazard injury claims. 
Read tweets on the topic below. Chelsea sub: Pedro on for Hazard. Another performance form the Belgian raising the question of whether he is fully fit.
